DOC.brief_title: Robotic Assisted Sacral Colpopexy : A Prospective Study Assessing Outcomes With Learning Curves
DOC.detailed_description: The investigator scientific aim determine benefit associate use robotic assist laparoscopic sacrocolpopexy surgery woman prolapse , define benefit impact patient , physician institution , determine complication associate use robot . This prospective cohort follow 100 patient 24 month period . The investigator primary outcome : - Surgical time : Key portion procedure assess along total time completion - Learning curve : Will assess use surgical time , VAS camera skill , surgical skill involve tissue handle movement overall performance surgeon , assistant blind reviewer - Length hospitalization : measure day hopsital The investigator secondary outcome : - Pre-operative postoperative Pelvic Organ Prolapse-Quantification ( POP-Q ) 6 week , 6 , 12 , 24 month . - Pelvic Floor Distress Inventory-Short Form 20 Questionnaire ( PFDI-20 ) - Mesh erosion , - Estimated blood loss , - Complications ( bowel bladder injury ) , - Wound infection , - Patient Global Impressions Improvement - Pelvic Organ Prolapse/Urinary Incontinence Sexual Questionnaire ( PISQ-12 ) .
DOC.criteria: > 18 year old Females Undergoing robotic assist laparoscopic sacrocolpopexy without procedure pelvic organ prolapse Willing return followup visit Written inform consent obtain subject Decline participate Pregnant contemplating future pregnancy ( within year ) Unable participate inform consent process
